intro: Goeppertia eichleri, commonly known as the Eichler's calathea, is a tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the Marantaceae family and is characterized by its striking, mottled foliage with deep green and silver veins. The plant typically grows as an upright herb with broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a houseplant or in shaded garden settings.
